official-title.#text:
To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to improve the transparency,
			 accountability, governance, and operations of the Office of Financial
			 Research, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: The Office of Financial Research Accountability Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 153 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:153

header.#text: Additional duties of the Office of Financial Research

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, after a period of 60 days for public notice and comment, annually publish a
			 detailed work plan concerning the priorities of the Office for the
			 upcoming fiscal year.

text.#text:
A unique alphanumeric identifier and detailed description of any report, study, working paper,
			 grant, guidance, data collection, or request for information that is
			 expected to be in progress during, or scheduled to begin in, the upcoming
			 fiscal year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a target date for any significant actions related to such
			 item, including the target date—

for, and topics of, a meeting of a working paper group and each solicitation of applications for
			 grants; and
for the issuance of guidance, data collections, or requests for information.
